summary:
Overview
The purpose of this document is to describe the functionality of the Data Capture API. Its intended audience are Android developers. The Data Capture API is an application programming interface which provides a number of specific commands that another application can use to control certain aspects of data capture on Android devices.

Before you get started
In order to use the EMDK for Xamarin, you must have the Xamarin Platform installed on your development system. Xamarin Studio will be installed as part of the Xamarin Platform.

summary:
Watch This Guide

Installing the Add-in
Before Installing this Add-in make sure your Xamarin Studio version is at least 5.9.5 or above.

Open Xamarin Studio

Open Xamarin Studio Add-in Manager
	
	For windows, select Tools  Add-in Manager

	For Mac, select Xamarin Studio  Add-in Manager

Then select the Gallery Tab 
Enter emdk in the search box in the top right corner of the Add-in Manager.

The Browser Manager allows you to configure browser settings like the default home page.

Overview

The version of MX on a device is a factor in determining if certain settings will be supported. There are a few ways that you can determine the version that is installed:

Manually using the Settings UI
From application code at runtime using the EMDK
Submitting XML using the MX CSP
Using ADB

 Using the Settings UI 

The version of MX on a Zebra Android KitKat device you can visually look in the Settings UI to determine the MX version installed:

 Note: This is only available on KitKat 4.4+ or later versions of Zebra Android devices.
